entry.title: Re: Customizing Extraction Fields in SAP Document Informa...
entry.content:
Hi Kevinkim0908

You can also edit schemas in the trial version, but as the error message tells, you can't and shouldn't change the schemas delivered by SAP - this rule is in any version also in premium. 

Instead you can copy the schema and then change the copy.

Please also note that you can't edit any schema if it has status activated.

With below screenshots I show an example how to copy a schema.

Click the Schema Configuration button to get the overview of schemas:

I want a modified copy of the SAP_PurchaseOrder_Schema, so I press the copy button on the line for that schema:

In the popup I give the copy a name and description:

Now I have a copy of the SAP standard schema.

Note that the new schema has status DRAFT. You can only edit schemas with status DRAFT. 

When you finish your changes, you must activate the schema before it can be used. After activation, you can not edit the schema anymore, but you can create a new version and then edit the new version. You can also deactivate the schema and then edit it without creating a new version. If you just want to play around with a trial, you may not need to use versions, but for real projects that has gone live, there are multiple good reasons to use versions.

After I activate my copy, you can see in below screen that the Edit button is "greyed out", and the buttons Create Version and Deactivate now are the primary options.

 

Kind regards

Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: Re: How to prevent developer to import transports through...
entry.content: I think the easiest would be to remove import authorizations in the Production managed system for the developer user and the TMW RFC user. This way, only users authorized in production will be able to import in production. If you keep the _TMW RFC user with import authorizations, any user can import in production.

entry.title: Suggestion: Add SWPM Warning for Known NetWeaver Java Copy Issue (SAP Note 3252460)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’d like to bring attention to a recurring challenge when copying SAP NetWeaver Java systems and propose a small enhancement to the Software Provisioning Manager (SWPM) that could save administrators a lot of time and confusion.

Background

  • Since 2022, attempts to create a copy of any NetWeaver Java system complete without visible errors in SWPM.

  • However, the cloned instance fails to start during the bootstrap phase, producing cryptic startup errors.

Error Symptom

After a seemingly successful SWPM run, the Java stack logs show messages like:

Code
...сom.sap.engine.bootstrap.SynchronizationException: Cannot read manager properties from database. Check database consistency...

...com.sap.engine.lib.config.api.exceptions.ClusterConfigurationException: Cannot retrieve the configuration structure corresponding to manager name LicensingManager...

...Caused by: com.sap.engine.frame.core.configuration.ConfigurationException: Internal error during the decryption process...

...Caused by: com.sap.security.core.server.secstorefs.InvalidStateException: Internal error during the decryption process...

Root Cause

All details and the corrective steps are documented in SAP Note 3252460. I’m grateful that this note exists and clearly explains how to resolve the startup failures.

Enhancement Proposal

Over the last three years, numerous SWPM versions have been released—yet none include a pre-copy warning or direct reference to SAP Note 3252460. Could we please add an informational pop-up or console message in SWPM whenever a Java-stack copy is initiated? For example:

Warning: Copies of NetWeaver Java systems may fail to start after bootstrap. Please refer to SAP Note 3252460 for detailed instructions.

Embedding this reminder into SWPM would:

  • Alert administrators before they complete a lengthy copy operation

  • Point them directly to the official SAP Note for a proven fix

  • Reduce support incidents and improve overall system-copy success rates

 

Thank you to the SAP SWPM development team for considering this suggestion. I’m confident that this small change will have a big impact on the daily work of BASIS teams worldwide.

Best regards, Dzmitry

SAP Basis Administrator

 

#SAPNetWeaver #SWPM #SAPNote3252460 #JavaStack #SystemCopy

entry.title: Using Sales BOM in a TAS flow
entry.content:
We are planning to selling T-shirts in a bundle. Each size has their own material number and the bundle is a top material in a Sales BOM. The bundle is sourced directly from a supplier, so we are using a TAS flow in SD to create a purchase requisition. All lines are created on the purchase requisition and the purchase order afterwards - this is as requested. The challenge is that we cannot see how the purchase order lines are linked together and thereby we cannot show the supplier how they are linked (in an Idoc).

We are receiving EDI order confirmations and ASN's (future also invoice). I would expect that the supplier would either send these information on either bundle level or on the individual material level - not both.

By working with this process I do not know if it would be possible to use Sales BOM's together with the TAS flow. Have anyone implemented a flow like this and which assumptions have been needed to have succes with this setup?

entry.title: Re: IN SAP BTP subaccount Can not find 【Document Manageme...
entry.content:
Hi @yan_zhang25 

If you cannot find the Document Management Service in your SAP BTP subaccount, here are some steps and checks I suggest you should consider to activate it:

First, go to your global account in the BTP Cockpit and navigate to "Entitlements." Ensure that your subaccount has the necessary entitlement for Document Management Service for example either Integration Option or Repository Option. If you do not see it, add it via Entitlement Assignment.

Then make sure your subaccount has Cloud Foundry enabled and at least you have created one space, as the DMS service requires Cloud Foundry runtime.

Thereafter, in your subaccount, go to Service Marketplace and search for Document Management Service. If you still do not see it, check if your region supports this service. DMS is not available in every region, so you may need to create your subaccount in a supported region.

Finally, once it becomes visible in your Service Marketplace, then click Create or Subscribe to enable you provision the Document Management Service for your subaccount.

 

To summarize, assign the entitlement for DMS to your subaccount, then ensure Cloud Foundry is active and a space exists and finally check your region compatibility if DMS is still missing

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Malaysia Digita...
entry.content:
Hello Mervyn, referring to your points below:

What this means for you:

  • You can continue using v1.0 without digital signatures and remain compliant.
  • Our team is reviewing how SAP DRC should handle certificate/key pair requirements in v1.0 scenarios to align with actual technical needs.
  • To avoid blocking your tests, you can generate a self-signed certificate and upload it under your TIN in the DRC Communication Settings. This will allow connections to IRBM to work.

Has SAP now reviewed how SAP DRC should handle certificate/key pair requirements in v1.0 scenarios to align with actual v1.0 IRBM technical needs - which does not require authentication of certificate at all. The current proposed workaround of generating self-signed certificate doesn't seem like a sustainable one, just for the purpose of proceeding with SIT and UAT. How about Production Go-Live later? Appreciate if you could provide further input/feedback.

entry.title: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

 

We are automating batch and serial number determination during outbound delivery.

  • Batch should be determined automatically.

  • Serial numbers (received from a third-party system and stored in a custom table) should be assigned automatically when navigating to Extras → Serial Numbers.

For batch determination, I found the exit USEREXIT_BATCH_DETERMINATION.
Could you please suggest which exit or BAdI can be used for automatic serial number assignment?

Is there any Other ways to approach this requirement?

entry.title: Re: Using Sales BOM in a TAS flow
entry.content:
The core challenge I could see in your process is that SAP’s standard TAS flow doesn’t inherently preserve the Sales BOM hierarchy in the purchase order. Each component is treated as a separate PO line item, and there's no native link back to the bundle (header material) in the PO or IDoc structure. This makes it difficult to show the supplier how the items relate to the bundle. Receive confirmations or ASNs at the bundle level.

May be you can try with the below approach

  • Use a custom field (e.g., “Bundle ID” or “Sales BOM Header”) in each PO line item. Populate it during PR/PO creation using a BAdI like ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST. This allows you to group PO lines in the IDoc and show linkage to the bundle.
  • PO line items created via TAS flow carry sales order references in table EKKN (fields VBELN, POSNR). You can use this to trace back to the original sales order and infer the bundle structure.
  • Enhance the outbound IDoc (e.g., ORDERS05) to include the bundle reference. Use the custom field or EKKN logic to group related lines. This helps the supplier understand the relationship between individual items and the bundle.
  • Align with your supplier on whether they will confirm at bundle level or component level. If they confirm at bundle level, you may need to aggregate confirmations and map them back to PO lines. If they confirm at component level, ensure your inbound IDoc processing can match each item correctly.

The above suggestions are taking into consideration:

  • The supplier understands and agrees to your bundle logic.
  • Your system can track and expose the bundle-component relationship in purchasing documents.
  • You’re able to enhance IDoc structures and map inbound/outbound messages accordingly.
  • You have control over custom fields and BAdIs to inject bundle references during PO creation.

entry.title: Re: error: Enter only digits; while creating a record in...
entry.content:
Hello, @Bharath369 

I think, the error is because you're trying to write a name into the Customer ID field, which should be numeric....
Try to change your value help to:

@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{entity: { name: '*****I_CUSTOMER_VH',

element: 'customer_id' }}]



Also, make sure that in the CDS, the Customer ID is defined as a number.

Hope this helps.

BR, Oleg

entry.title: Re: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
You can try with BAdI IQSM_SERIAL_NUMBER or EXIT_SAPLV51E_002. In fact, the User Exit EXIT_SAPLV51E_002 is ideal for straightforward scenarios where serial numbers are fetched from a custom table and assigned during delivery. Easier to implement and maintain and triggered when navigating to Extras → Serial Numbers.

BAdI is better suited for complex logic or integration with external systems. Allows you to handle serial number assignment dynamically. Recommended if your process involves validations, conditions, or multiple sources.

entry.title: SolMan number of maximum of connected terminals reached
entry.content:
Hi SAP Support,

We are encountering the same issue again, and we have not yet configured the parameter rdisp/tm_max_no.

  1. Could you please provide the recommended value for rdisp/tm_max_no?
  2. Does changing this parameter require a system restart?

Thank you.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SolMan number of maximum of connected terminals reached
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Please be aware of that default value 1000 of parameter rdisp/tm_max_no is the recommended value from SAP perspective. In case it not meet your requirement, kindly determine the value using trial and error method.

Besides, parameter rdisp/tm_max_no is not a dynamic parameter, hence, the system restart is required when you want to make its new changed value take effective.

Best Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud : Setup Client ID/Secret, Us...
entry.content:
Hi @yashoratna 

To implement your scenario in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud you will need to complete some steps. Let me walk you through it.

First you need to maintain Credentials in SAP Communication Arrangement. To do this, go to Communication Management in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, then create a Communication User. Ensure you maintain the user ID and password provided by your third party. Then create or maintain a Communication System. Here you can specify the system details and assign the user for authentication. For REST APIs needing OAuth client credentials, some implementations will allow you to store your client ID and secret in the Communication System details, or you can use an external secure storage or manage them in your designated program logic.

Secondly, make sure to use Credentials in ABAP to Call REST API. In your ABAP code, use HTTP Client classes to call the token endpoint with a POST request, passing user ID, password, client ID your and client secret according to the third party's OAuth2 specification. Then make sure to retrieve the bearer token from the response. For that use the bearer token in the authorization header for the second API call to send data.

Finally, you will replicate the Postman process programmatically. You should first call the authentication endpoint with your required parameters, receive the token, and then use that token for your subsequent API calls. There is no need for an IDP certificate upload if the third party does not use it. Instead, stick with your Basic Authentication and direct parameter usage with OAuth2 client credentials.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: DMEE XML File truncated after S/4HANA 2023 upgrade
entry.content:
Hi All,

Please note that DMEE will become obsolete starting from version 2025.

However, in S/4HANA 2023 we have identified an ABAP bug in the method TO_FILE of class CL_DMEE_OUTPUT_FILE.

Currently, the variables are declared as NUMC4, but they should be declared as TYPE I.

Best regards,

Alessandro

entry.title: Unlocking the Potential of Templates in SAP Build Store: A UX-Led Transformation
entry.content:
In early 2024, we discovered something surprising.
The average user spent just 1 minute and 14 seconds in the SAP Build Store. Even more striking: nearly 60% of users left within 15 seconds.

We had invested in pre-designed, ready-to-use solutions, what we call Templates, to accelerate project creation, reduce repetitive tasks, and improve efficiency across SAP Build. But the data told us something else: the feature was practically invisible.

The challenge: our locked treasure

Why was engagement so low? Our research revealed a few key reasons:

  • Terminology like “Store” and “Ready to Use” was confusing
  • The design was outdated and not aligned with SAP’s Fiori guidelines
  • Navigation was weak, leaving users without clear entry points
  • Most users only discovered the feature via a lobby shortcut. Without it, usage dropped dramatically

We had a powerful capability, but no visibility.

The original design: outdated, unclear, and often overlooked

 

Strategic context and research

This redesign was not done in isolation. It aligned with the SAP Build 2025 strategy, which emphasizes predefined processes and best practices to accelerate time to value.

We also reviewed how similar solutions in the market are positioned. A common theme was the strong emphasis on clarity and discoverability, which reinforced the importance of making SAP’s Templates more visible and actionable

 

The big idea: make Templates impossible to ignore

Our guiding principle was simple: Visibility, Clarity, Efficiency.
If users did not see it, they would not use it.

So the mission was twofold:

  1. Make Templates more discoverable, even without shortcuts
  2. Clarify their purpose so users could quickly understand and act

 

Transformation in action

We redesigned the experience with these goals in mind:

  • Consistency: A modern, structured UI aligned with SAP’s design language
  • Navigation: Clearer pathways and filters so users could find relevant templates more easily
  • Cards: A more engaging presentation with images, clearer actions, and hierarchy
  • Clarity: New status badges and improved copy to reduce confusion
  • Guidance: A new dialog to help users understand the difference between Pre-built and Sample templates
  • Terminology: We also introduced several naming changes to reduce confusion and better reflect the feature’s purpose, such as renaming “Store” to Templates, “Ready to Use” to Pre-built, and “Template” to Sample. These adjustments might look small, but they made the feature’s value clearer and easier to understand.

In short, the redesign turned Templates from a hidden corner into a visible, structured, and valuable part of the experience.

The redesigned templates: clearer hierarchy, modern visuals, and consistent actions..

 New Select Template dialog: shown when creating a template that supports both options, helping users choose between Pre-built and Sample with clearer guidance.

 

Testing with users

To validate the new approach, we ran two usability studies:

  • July 2024: with 6 internal SAP colleagues who used the Store daily
  • December 2024: with 5 SAP customers from Vodafone, AIRBUS, Merck, and Twinnings

The feedback was clear:

  • Users finally understood Templates
  • Many admitted they had not known the feature even existed before
  • Excitement grew as they realized Templates could meaningfully support their workflows

One participant summed it up:

“Positive step to move from Store to Template. The UI is much better from the old Store, it is awesome.”

 

The impact

This redesign has not yet been developed, and there is no confirmed timeline for implementation.
But the usability studies made one thing clear:

  • More visibility → more usage
  • More clarity → more efficiency
  • More usability → more business value

 

Key takeaways

  • Do not wait for permission. If something is broken, fix it
  • Business impact and usability go hand in hand
  • Visibility is everything. If users do not see it, they will not use it

This journey reminded me that some of the most impactful UX work is not about adding new features, but about unlocking the hidden value that already exists.

Have you faced a similar challenge in making an important feature more visible and usable? I’d love to hear how you approached it in your product.

entry.title: Re: CAP application handling of innererror returned from...
entry.content:
Hi @kasp1234567 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

The issue you are facing is a known limitation in CAP applications. By default, detailed innererror information returned from the SAP backend is not propagated in production mode. Please note that typically, you get a generic 502 error without specifics. This protects sensitive info but makes debugging harder. You do have a possibility to address this. Here is my take on that.

Please note that there is per se no standard CAP handler that automatically forwards all innererror details. However, you have the option to implement a custom error handler in your CAP service to capture and format these errors before sending the response to the client.

In your service implementation inspect the error object and explicitly forward SAP backend details if present as part of the response.

It is important to note that in some cases, you may need to change how errors and responses are handled in your forwarding logic. For example, when using service.txrequest.run, wrap the call in a try-catch block and manually examine the returned error, checking for innererror properties.

For your production space, also consider security and avoid exposing detailed backend info to end users.

To summarize, no out-of-the-box CAP setting automatically exposes SAP OData innererror in production profile. You should implement a custom error handler in your CAP Node.js app to explicitly catch and forward error details as needed.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Indicating Errors

entry.title: BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE - Delivery completed indicator not updated without error

entry.title: Process to Reactivate a S-User ID which was deleted sometime back
entry.content:
We want to reactivate a S-User ID which was deleted sometime back because the user moved to the other department, now user has joined back our team and we want to restore his earlier S-user id again.

What's the process for that ?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Process to Reactivate a S-User ID which was deleted s...
entry.content:
Once an S-user ID has been deleted, it cannot be reactivated under any circumstances. This action is permanent, and all associated roles and authorizations are lost.

If the deleted S-user requires access to SAP systems again, the Super Administrator within your company must create a new S-user ID for that individual.

For detailed guidance on this process, please refer to the following SAP Knowledge Base Article:
1811859 - Can deleted S-user IDs be reactivated? - SAP for Me

Kind regards, 
SAP Product Support

entry.title: Re: Custom Fiori Application in 2SL System
entry.content:
Hello @SaiBhargav396 

For S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition (2SL), the best supported method to run custom UI5 apps is side-by-side on SAP BTP, then expose them to users through SAP Build Work Zone (Launchpad) or SAP Start. You do not deploy freestyle UI5 into S/4HANA Cloud.

Quick plan to explore!

  1. Expose data from S/4: utilise released APIs/CDS. If necessary, create a Custom CDS View and a Custom Communication Scenario, then configure the Communication System/Arrangement.
  2. Secure connectivity: create a BTP Destination to S/4 with principal propagation IAS trust; OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion.
  3. Build the UI: develop a Fiori elements/UI5 app in Business Application Studio linked to that destination.
  4. Deploy and launch: deploy to HTML5 App Repository and publish the tile in Work Zone / SAP Start; assign role collections.
  5. Transport: transfer between accounts using Cloud Transport Management (or CI/CD).

When to build in S/4 (ABAP Cloud/RAP) is only if Developer Extensibility is enabled in your tenant and you require server-side logic; still, expose the UI via Work Zone/SAP Start.

Refer to listed SAP Helpful documentations below

Extensibility overview (S/4HANA Cloud Public):

Custom CDS Views / Custom Comm. Scenarios:

Business Application Studio (build Fiori/UI5):

BTP Destinations & IAS (principal propagation):

SAP Build Work Zone

SAP Build Work Zone (Launchpad)

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE - Delivery completed indicator n...
entry.content:
The field no_more_gr in BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE is only relevant for purchase orders, not for production orders or reservations. For production orders, the "delivery completed" status is controlled by the reservation item (RESB) and the order component status, which are not automatically updated by this BAPI. Even though the BAPI posts the goods movement successfully, it does not trigger status updates in the production order component list (CO03).

There’s no standard BAPI to update the "delivery completed" indicator for production order components, but you can try with BAPI_RESERVATION_CHANGE

entry.title: Financing with Taulia: Dynamic Discounting with Credit Memos
entry.content:
Starting from SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508, the dynamic discounting scenario in Payables Financing supports posting discounts via credit memos.

Dynamic discounting is a financial strategy that allows suppliers to receive early payments from buyers by offering discounts on invoices. Previously, the dynamic discounting process only supported the Invoice Adjustment discount type, which offers the discount directly against the original invoice amount. Now, a new discount type, Discount by Credit Memo, has been introduced. When a discount is considered a rebate, it can now be posted with a credit memo in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system on a date agreed upon by the supplier and buyer. This ensures businesses accurately report deductions in trade payables and value-added tax (VAT) liabilities to tax authorities.

Process Flow

  1. The buyer posts supplier invoices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  2. The supplier takes the early payment offer on the Taulia Platform and requests an early payment for selected invoices.
  3. The early payment request is sent to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Based on the early payment request, a payables financing order is created automatically with the Discount by Credit Memo discount type. Upon the creation of the financing order, a credit memo is also created and posted for the discount.

    In the Display Payables Financing Orders app, the credit memo and the leading invoice are included as line items of the financing order and the credit memo is linked to the leading invoice via an invoice reference. The details of the credit memo are replicated to the Taulia Platform.

  4. The buyer pays the supplier on the agreed early payment date.
  5. The supplier gets an early payment from the buyer.
Note

The buyer can raise a ticket on the Taulia Platform to cancel an early payment request. Once canceled, the status of the payables financing order updates to Canceled in the Display Payables Financing Orders app. At the same time, the system automatically reverses and clears the credit memo, updating its clearing status to Cleared Item and generating a clearing journal entry.

Examples of the User Interface

Note

The screenshots are examples to make the described change visible. Please note that the screenshots show the English version of the user interface only, and that the user interface in your system might look slightly different due to configuration and extensibility options available.

The following screenshot shows how it looks in the system when a credit memo is created and posted for a discount:

Implementation Details

Configuration

To enable the new discount type of dynamic discounting, ensure relevant settings are made in the following configuration activities in your configuration environment:

  • Define Company Codes for Receivable Items/Payable Items (ID: 106901)

  • Define Number Range Intervals for Payables Financing Orders (ID: 106893)

  • Automatic Account Determination (ID: 100297)

    In this activity, proceed as follows to define a dedicated G/L account for posting dynamic discounts:
    1. In the Area section, maintain the fields as below:
      • Area: Financial Accounting
      • Subarea: Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable
      • Process: Define Accounts for Payment Transactions
    2. In the Parameters section, maintain the fields as below:
      • Transaction Group: SKN (Cash Discount and Payment Differences)
      • Transaction Key: SKD (Dynamic Discount for Payables Financing)
      • Chart of Accounts: Enter a chart of accounts.
    3. In the Account Assignments section, specify a G/L account for debit postings.
    Note

    The system also supports posting discounts via credit memos for invoices related to fixed asset acquisitions. To do this, ensure that a G/L account is assigned as a technical clearing account for integrated asset acquisitions in the Assign G/L Accounts (ID: 102622) configuration activity.

    Note

    If the leading invoice contains CO account assignment objects (for example, cost center), the credit memo is also posted with the same account assignment objects. If not, make sure the dedicated G/L account for posting dynamic discounts has CO account assignment objects defined in the Manage Default Account Assignments (ID: 102639) configuration activity.

entry.title: Re: In GRC PC, where Control group/Subgroups are used
entry.content:
Hi @PLABAN_SAHOO8 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Control groups and subgroups in SAP are used in various contexts depending on the module. Here are a few areas it is used for:

Marketing: For campaign effectiveness analysis, control groups represent non-targeted segments to compare results against targeted customers.

Global Trade Services: This is used for classifying products under legal regulations to streamline licensing, export control, and compliance checks.

HR/Payroll: Employee groups and subgroups help categorize employees for payroll rules, benefits eligibility, and work regulations.

User Access: It helps organizing users into groups and subgroups for detailed role and access management.

The table below provides you with a summarized detail.

 

Area

Purpose/Usage

Marketing

Effectiveness analysis, experiment control in campaigns

Trade Compliance

Product classification for import/export regulations, license checks

HR/Payroll

Categorizing employees for pay, benefits, and rules

User Groups/Subgroups

Organizing users, roles, and access control

I hope this provides more detail. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Delegating workflows only to the users above delegator's position hierarchy
entry.content:
@crisdagosto 

 

Change the rule, instead of checking if is position user below, check if delegatee position = delegator position.higher level position.    Add that several times (higher level position. higher level position. higher level position) until you cover your maximum org unit depth and you get the validation for only managers up the structure not peers not manager's peers etc..

 

Cheers,

Francisco

entry.title: Re: Material Ledger - Actual Activity Price Calculated in...
entry.content:
Please refer this note: 1606106 - No issue of error message CKMLLA102 if actual price is zero


Reason and Prerequisites
The actual price of zero either cannot be avoided or is actually intentional. Unlike the standard SAP system, the system is simply supposed to issue a warning message instead of error message CKMLLA 102. The system is supposed to proceed as follows with the relevant activity type:

Alternative 1: The activity type is handled in all currencies or valuations as if the "Do Not Consider Price" indicator was set. See Note 872421 for more information about the "Do Not Consider Price" indicator.
Alternative 2: In the multilevel price determination, the actual price zero is supposed to be used in the currency or valuation affected.
Solution
Implement the attached program corrections. To set message CKMLLA 102 as a warning message, make an entry in the table CKMLMVADMIN with KKEY 'CKMLLA102' and

KDATA 'IGNORE' if you want the activity type affected to be handled according to alternative 1
or

KDATA 'USE' if you want the activity type affected to be handled according to alternative 2.

entry.title: RAP BO for existing CDS views vs. Custom Entity
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

My idea is to build a Fiori Elements application that displays data from existing CDS views, like EnterpriseProject and JournalEntry. I wanted to ask, what, in your opinion, would be the most correct way forward - creating new custom Root view (and a behavior definition for it) based on standard CDS view (like I_EnterpriseProject) or rather defining Custom Entity and then defining an unmanaged behavior definition for it?

My thought process is that - if standard CDS views are (re)used, it takes care of query functionality and I won't need to implement the query class to fetch the data.

What is your experience in building such apps? I would appreciate any feedback.

Regards,

Ilja.

entry.title: Re: Verification of Payee (VoP) - What is planned in SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team, 

we use APM (FIN-FSCM-PF) in combination with BCM (FIN-FSCM-BKN) and MBC (LOD-FSN-AGT) to process, approve and send SEPA Payments to the bank via EBICS Connection. 

Will there be a general FAQ?

  • Questions for MBC:
    • Do we need to open a separate ticket for the new order types for Pain.001.001.03 and Pain.002.001.02, or will these be activated for all customers across the board? For us, these are
      • Pain.001.001.03 / Pain.001.001.09 -> EBICS order type CTV
      • Pain.002.001.02 / Pain.002.001.10 -> EBICS order type VPZ
      • Currently, we have to open a ticket for each new order type requesting activation on MBC side.
    • We only use Pain.002.001.03 so far, will you activate Pain.002.001.10 for all Customers? Do we need to request this? The bank will probably switch to Pain.002.001.10.
    • The Pain.002 VPZ responses with the VoP Results will be provided asap by the banks (e.g. within 5-10 secs). We currently pull every 10 minutes from MBC Cloud Tennant. What would be your best practice for this? We do not want to change it to 5-10 secs for every case. 
    • Lets say we have a Close Match or No Match where the payer (customer, we) need to approve or reject the respective payment order after it was already sent. In the blog, it is mentioned, that every customer should go into a Bank Portal and do this. We do not have Bank Portals were we can logon. 
      • Lets say we want to develop something on our own, how would we be even able to send the approval / reject for the already sent MCB message (inital payment file) to the bank via MBC (VEU)? 
      • Lets say, we want to adjust the Payment order (APM) and send the adjusted Payment Order again via MBC. How would this work for a Payment Order which already has a MBC Message mapped to it (the initial one). 
  • Questions to APM: 
    • Lets say we have a Close Match or No Match where the payer (customer, we) need to approve or reject the respective payment order after it was already sent. In the blog, it is mentioned, that every customer should go into a Bank Portal and do this. We do not have Bank Portals were we can logon. 
      • Can we generate a new MBC Message for a Payment Order which already has a MBC Message mapped to it (initial sent one)
      • Lets say, we want to adjust the Payment order (APM) and send the adjusted Payment Order again via MBC. How would this work for a Payment Order which already has a MBC Message mapped to it (the initial one).

entry.title: Re: Requirements Status - Cloud ALM
entry.content: To be approved & Ready for approval status are linked with In-refinement of requirement and so oveall requirement is in planning stage. Moving forward following are the status to proceed like given below: In realization: Development and testing are in progress. Confirmed: The requirement is successfully implemented and tested. Rejected: The requirement was not approved or deemed not feasible. Blocked: The requirement is blocked due to some dependency or issue. Not planned: The requirement is not planned for implementation.

entry.title: Re: OpenText xECM connect with S/4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @VenkyJ 

For S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, the supported integration with OpenText xECM/Core Content is via CMIS using SAP Document Management Service (DMS), an integration option on SAP BTP. S/4HANA utilises its Attachment Service to store and read documents through this connection. (ArchiveLink isn’t supported in Public Cloud.)

Here's what you need to do!

  1. BTP: Provision Document Management, Integration Option and onboard your OpenText CMIS repository (register the CMIS endpoint in DMS).
  2. S/4HANA Cloud: Create a Communication User/System and a Communication Arrangement for scenario SAP_COM_0597 – Third-Party Repository Integration, pointing it to the DMS endpoint.
  3. Authorise and test: Ensure users have the usual app roles, then upload a test attachment paperclip in an S/4 app and verify it’s stored in OpenText.

Notes: All access must go through the S/4 Attachment Service (avoid custom direct CMIS calls). For more advanced workspace and records features, you can add OpenText Extended ECM on top; the S/4 side will still connect via CMIS/DMS.

SAP Help – Integrate S/4HANA Cloud with Document Management service (Integration Option)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Signavio Active Users list

entry.title: Re: Lumira Bookmark "Error during script processing"
entry.content:
Hi @marcus_rehnen 

The error you are facing is usually caused by missing authorizations at the Bookmark folder level in the BI Launchpad or Central Management Console. I would suggest the following approach:

Log on to the CMC, navigate to Applications à SAP Lumira. Then right-click and Manage Folders. Find the Bookmark folder used by your application.

In Folder Properties à User Security, make sure the affected user has proper rights on this specific Bookmark folder.

This folder-level authorization is separate from general BI Platform admin rights and controls the ability to create and retrieve bookmarks. Without these permissions, the bookmark function will fail with an error during script processing

If your authorization settings are correct but the problem persists, clear the user's BI client cache and check the browser security settings.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Process Automation – Configuring Microsoft 365 email provider for SMTP mail destinatio
entry.content:
Hello @melinaraptaki, hello @Mohan_Andhan 

Thank you for your comments.

This error typically appears when you haven't waited long enough after adding the mailbox permission. The Microsoft system needs time to process and apply the new permissions. That's why you see a successful login in Azure AD—the service is able to retrieve the authentication token but doesn't yet have the right to send an email on behalf of the application.

Please try again. If that doesn't work, depending on the error type, you can find more information in the developer console of your browser. Check under the Network tab and look at the specific request for mail sending to see additional error details.

Let me know if that helps.

Best regards,

Erwan

entry.title: Asset depreciation adjustment based on APC
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I tried to search the forum for similar threads on depreciation adjustment. However, I couldn't find one that meets my exact requirement.

I have a situation as below:

Asset was capitalized in FY22 for $60k for 5 years with a yearly dep of $12k.  It was depreciated from FY22 until FY24 for 12k X 3 = 36k.

Now in FY25, useful life to be adjusted to 10 years.

Now , the system recalculates the depreciation amount from FY25 only. i.e., it plans to depreciate the remaining $60k - $36k = $24k over the next 7 years. So from FY24 , yearly depreciation planned is $24k/7 = $3.34k. 

The current depreciation key used is as below

 

However, the requirement is that the new depreciation amount is to be recalculated from beginning as 60k/10 = 6k per year. And in FY25, an adjustment to be auto-posted to reduce FY22 to FY24 deprecation amount .

Adjustment amount  = [36 k - (6k X3)] = 18k. This -18k is to be posted in FY25 as an adjustment and continue to depreciate 6k over the remaining years. 

Please advise based on which depreciation key , I can achieve the above requirement. 

regards,

Ratheesh

entry.title: Re: I want to display the legend titles on the SAC chart.
entry.content:
Hi @tsuuuu 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through the options.

In SAP Analytics Cloud, you have the possibility to display legend titles on charts by enabling and configuring the legend title in the chart's formatting options. You can achieve that by taking the following steps:

Go into Design mode then open the Format panel for your chart.

Thereafter select the legend section.

Then check the option Legend Title to enable it.

Also, you can click the arrow next to the checkbox to customize or create a legend title as needed.

Finally, you can adjust settings like symbol size, position, layout, and text formatting in the same panel.

Please keep in mind that if the chart or its container is too small, not all your legend labels or titles may display fully. Increasing the chart size or viewing in full screen often helps showing the complete legend. This will enable your chart to display legend titles similar to your example image.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Unable to Access SAP EarlyWatch Alert Workspace – Authorization Already Provided
entry.content:
Hi Sap,


We are unable to access the SAP EarlyWatch Alert (PERSON_NAME) Workspace in SAP ONE Support Launchpad.
Although the required authorization roles have already been assigned (as visible in authorization management), the system still displays the following error message when attempting to open EarlyWatch Alert:
 
> “No Authorization. Contact your company administrator to request the required authorizations.”
  
Steps already checked: 
Verified that the user has the correct PERSON_NAME display roles (Display Security Alerts in SAP EarlyWatch Alert Workspace). 
Cross-checked in SAP Support Portal authorization assignment table. 
 
Expected Result:
Assigned users with the correct authorizations should be able to access and display EarlyWatch Alert data in the SAP ONE Support Launchpad.
 
Actual Result:
Users are receiving a No Authorization error despite having the correct access assigned.


Error logs attached for your reference


Please assign to Component: XX-SER-SAPSMP-IBX (or XX-SER-NET-IBC depending on portal issue category)
 


Thanks 


Akilan K


--- Support Assistant ---
Service Messages


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Access SAP EarlyWatch Alert Workspace – Aut...
entry.content:
After reviewing your case, I’ve identified that your S-user ID does not currently have all the required authorizations assigned. To access the SAP EarlyWatch Alert Workspace, an S-user must have the following authorizations:

  • Service Reports and Feedback
  • Display Security Alerts in SAP EarlyWatch Alert Workspace
  • Manage Alert(s) in SAP EarlyWatch Alert for all S-users

Typically, these authorizations can be granted by your administrator, who can be found under the Users & Contacts section in SAP for Me. For more detailed information, please refer to KBA 2905076 - S-user ID authorizations required for SAP EarlyWatch applications -SAP for Me

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: /CEECV/ROFI10 field Total doc.incl.VAT is not updated...
entry.content:
Hi @sherry_ren 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

The issue typically indicates that some configuration or customization steps for the new tax codes have been missed. I suggest you check the following points and process steps:

Please note, the report /CEECV/ROFI10 relies heavily on the tax code configuration being consistent with the local Romanian tax requirements.

Be aware that new tax codes must be fully integrated into the FI-LOC-RO customizing, especially those related to VAT and tax procedure assignment.

Ensure to verify your designated tax codes are included in relevant tax procedures and your condition records.

It is important that the BC Set customizing for Romanian VAT reports has been updated and activated accordingly

Also note, activation of the appropriate layouts and designated tax codes via BC Sets or manual customizing transport is necessary. This step ensures your tax codes are recognized and calculated correctly in the report's ALV layout.

To summarize, you likely missed applying or activating the required BC Sets or customizing transport related to Romanian tax codes for the new tax codes in your system. After importing and activating the correct BC Sets for layouts and tax codes, the Total doc.incl.VAT field should update correctly.

You can refer to SAP Notes like 2233123 and 2224430 for further information.

I hope this provides the required details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
